snippet: Democratic leaders invoked the mass shooting in California in a failed attempt to shame Republicans, who had unanimously supported the bill, to reject Gov. Chris Christie’s veto.
abstract: Vote by New Jersey Assembly to override Gov Chris Christie's veto of gun-control bill is halted after it becomes clear that Republican support for override had dwindled; bill in question would require that police be notified if someone who wished to purchase gun was trying to expunge mental-health record.
lead_paragraph: Democratic leaders invoked the mass shooting in California in a failed attempt to shame Republicans, who had unanimously supported the bill, to reject Gov. Chris Christie’s veto.

headline.main: Christie’s Veto of Gun-Control Bill Is Upheld as Assembly Halts Override
headline.print_headline: Assembly Halts Override of Christie’s Gun-Bill Veto
